alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 9:49AM CDT until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and North Mississippi, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Phillips. In North Mississippi, Coahoma and Tunica. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marvell, Elaine, Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Friars Point, Tunica, Lexa, Kings, Dundee, Watkins Corner, Dubbs, North Tunica, Little Texas, Robinsonville, Lake View, Coahoma, Lula, Preston Place and Helena Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
